titleStmt.title: The Fate of France a discourse, wherein after having answered the groundless exceptions that are made against the lawful conduct of the English, in securing themselves from popish tyranny, &c., it is shewed that by the happy revolution in England, all the designs of the French king for the universal monarchy are disappointed, and the rational grounds to believe his downfal near : in three dialogues betwixt Father Petre, Father La Chaize, and two Protestant gentlemen.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: print show-through, with considerable loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
